content: four mandala fun crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet on instagram pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials size 47 by 66 inches 119 by 168 cm yarn dk weight light category 3 you will need 4 cakes of lion brand mandala mandala baby or cupcake yarn that is 2 360 yards 2 160 meters of yarn the sample blanket used 4 cakes of lion brand mandala yarn 100% acrylic 590 yards 450 m per 150-gram cake two cakes in the colorway nifflers in the center and two cakes in the colorway narnia one on each end add the 2nd cake whenever the 1st one runs out starting at the same color the first cake ended with go with the flow of color changes- no cutting or controlling of colors needed see below for instructions on how to use the cakes to make a symmetrical blanket if you want to cut the yarn so that there are no row with color changes in the middle please feel free if you cut your cakes you may need more than 4 cakes to make a blanket of this size yarn dk weight mandala recommended hook size 5 mm us h gauge 13 double_crochet stitches = 4 inches 10 cm 8 row = 4 inches 10 cm terms us double_crochet double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over pull through two loops yarn over pull through both loops on hook foundation double_crochet optional a method for beginning a row without having to make a separate row of chains first see http //www mooglyblog com/foundation-double-crochet-fdc/ for a video tutorial csdc optional chainless starting double_crochet a method for beginning each row without having to chain this method helps to keep your edges straight see http //www mooglyblog com/chainless-starting-double-crochet/ for a video tutorial four mandala fun crochet pattern © 2020 by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful four mandala fun row 1 chain 152 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st stitch and all chains across 150 double_crochet or foundation double_crochet 150 stitches see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet this option gives a neat edge to the blanket row 2-65 chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet in next stitch and all stitches across 150 double_crochet note sometime around row 32 or 33 the 1st cake will run out attach the 2nd cake using the russian join method below or the method of your choice start the 2nd cake at the same color where your 1st cake ran out row 66 attach the 3rd cake to the 1st stitch of row 65 with a slip_stitch chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet in next stitch and all stitches across 150 double_crochet row 67-98 chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet in next stitch and all stitches across 150 double_crochet row 99 attach the 4th cake to the 1st stitch of row
